text.author: Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia
text.title: Ichiyō Higuchi
text.summary: Ichiyō Higuchi (pseudonym for Higuchi Natsu) was a Meiji era Japanese short story author, known for works such as Umoregi ("In Obscurity"), who, despite dying of tuberculosis at 24, became influential in Japanese literature and was commemorated on the Japense 5,000 yen banknote.
